bibl.title: Military Orders for Jefferson Randolph Kean, November 5, 1900

div1.p: Special Orders #260 revokes Special Orders #256 for Kean. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Jefferson Randolph Kean, November 5, 1900
div1.p:
FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Spec Orders
Vol 2 - 1900

HEADQUARTERS OF THE ARMY,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, November 5, 1900.

1. Corporal Charles J. Chambers, Company D, 15th Infan-
try, now at Fort Columbus, New York, is transferred as a pri-
vate to Company F, 15th Infantry. He will be sent to the
station of that company, Madison Barracks, New York, and
will report upon arrival to the commanding officer for duty.

2. Private John Kelly, Company L, 2d Infantry, now at
Fort Columbus, New York, is transferred to the home bat-
talion of that regiment. He will be sent to Fort Thomas,
Kentucky, and will report upon arrival to the battalion com-
mander for assignment to a company.

3. By direction of the Secretary of War, Private Thomas F.
Kelly, Battery C, 5th Artillery, Fort Hamilton, New York, will
be discharged from the Army, by way of favor, by the com-
manding officer of his station. This soldier is not entitled to
travel-pay.

4. By direction of the Secretary of War, Private William
Reeves, Company H, 5th Infantry, Fort Sheridan, Illinois,
will be discharged from the Army, by way of favor, by the
commanding officer of his station. This soldier is not entitled
to travel-pay.

5. By direction of the Secretary of War, Recruit Charles
Crest, mounted service, Jefferson Barracks, Missouri, will be
discharged from the Army by the commanding officer of that
post, by reason of being unsuited to the service. This soldier
is entitled to travel-pay.

6. By direction of the Secretary of War, Recruit Samuel H.
Burford, general service, Columbus Barracks, Ohio, will be
discharged from the Army by the commanding officer of that
post, by reason of being unsuited to the service. This soldier
is entitled to travel-pay.

7. By direction of the Secretary of War, paragraph 12,
Special Orders, No. 256, October 31, 1900, from this office, re-
lating to Major Jefferson R. Kean, surgeon, U. S. Volunteers,
and Captain George J. Newgarden, assistant surgeon, U. S.
Army, is revoked.
